snippet: Populations targeted by terrorists confront a danger that can be managed or policed but perhaps never entirely overcome....
abstract: Max Fisher The Interpreter column submits attack in Nice, France, in which ordinary truck was used to mow down pedestrians, killing 84, represents long-developing trend in which terror tactics become more rudimentary and targets more random; underscores fear that common security measures are of limited use in such cases; holds incident presents reality in which terrorism may be reduced or managed, but never eliminated.
lead_paragraph: Populations targeted by terrorists confront a danger that can be managed or policed but perhaps never entirely overcome.

headline.print_headline: Terror’s New Form: A Threat That Can Be Managed but Not Erased
headline.main: Attack in Nice, France, Represents Terrorism’s New Reality

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
